eu_initiatives: European Commission's "Preparation of the 2018 ICCAT Annual meeting - Meeting with Stakeholders", 17 October 2018. IPNLF would like to attend this consultation to represent the interests of handline and pole-and-line ("one-by-one") fisheries from the Azores, Canary Islands, and St Helena. Many one-by-one tuna supply chain stakeholders fishing or sourcing in/from these regions are IPNLF Members, e.g.: Federação das Pescas dos Açores, Fish4Ever, Islatuna, Optuna No 42, Pão-do-Mar, St Helena Fisheries Corporation. These organizations often do not have the capacity to attend stakeholder meetings to voice some of their concerns. We would like to address the handline/pole-and-line perspective on tropical tunas in the Atlantic Ocean region.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: The International Pole & Line Foundation (IPNLF) develops, supports, and promotes socially and environmentally responsible one-by-one tuna fisheries around the world. IPNLF’s overarching goal is to contribute to thriving coastal fisheries, including the people, communities, businesses and seas connected with them. We are an international charity working across science, policy and the seafood sector with staff located in the United Kingdom, Indonesia, Maldives, South Africa and the United States. IPNLF uses an evidence-based, solutions-focused approach with guidance from our Board of Trustees, Scientific & Technical Advisory Committee (STAC) and Markets Advisory Group (MAG).
